sentences.en: Ballet classes are important for poise and grace.
sentences.cn: 芭蕾课可以很好地使人保持优雅的仪态。

sentences.en: Deportment and poise were as important as good marks for young ladies.
sentences.cn: 对妙龄少女来说，仪态身姿和优秀成绩一样重要。

sentences.en: Even when he moved he did so without poise.
sentences.cn: 他就连走起路来也姿势难看。

sentences.en: Good poise is important for a dancer.
sentences.cn: 保持良好的平衡对舞蹈演员非常重要.

sentences.en: Great for the body and soul, yoga and meditation can improve your posture, poise, and confidence.
sentences.cn: 一边做瑜伽一边思考人生对身体和灵魂都非常好，它能改善你的体型、平衡和自信心。

sentences.en: He had regained completely his critical attitude, his cool, intellectual poise.
sentences.cn: 他完全恢复了他吹毛求疵的态度 以及 他那冷淡 、 聪明的姿态.

sentences.en: He thought of the tall man's poise and fluent way of talking.
sentences.cn: 他记起那一双靴子,闪闪发光,以为不是极好的山柿油涂到上面,是不会如此体面好看的.

sentences.en: His body, even now , had the poise and grace of a deer.
sentences.cn: 从他身上仍可以见到有一种鹿一般矫健的体态和风姿.

sentences.en: His voice was too tremulous , the poise of his feelings too doubtful.
sentences.cn: 他的声音太激动了, 他感情的宁静太可疑了.

sentences.en: It took a moment for Mark to recover his poise.
sentences.cn: 马克过了一会儿才恢复镇静。

sentences.en: Louisa seems to have much more poise and confidence.
sentences.cn: 路易莎似乎更加沉着自信了。

sentences.en: She hesitated briefly but quickly regained her poise.
sentences.cn: 她犹豫片刻,但很快恢复了镇静.

sentences.en: She is a beautiful girl with the grace and poise.
sentences.cn: 她是一位仪态优雅的佳丽.
她虽漂亮，但缺乏优雅的举止。

sentences.en: The teacher spoke with great poise and fluency.
sentences.cn: 那位老师说话沉着而流畅.

sentences.en: Wavell received the decision with poise and dignity.
sentences.cn: 韦维尔以安祥持重的态度接受了这项决定.

sentences.en: What amazed him even more than her appearance was her poise.
sentences.cn: 她的容貌让他惊叹，而更让他惊讶的是她的沉着。

sentences.en: Yet the man had the air and the poise of a gentleman.
sentences.cn: 然而这个人却有着绅士的态度和架子.

words.tran_cn: 泰然自若的，镇定的；平衡的，均衡的；摆好姿势不动的，静止的

trans.tran_cn: 泰然自若，自信，沉着，体态，姿态
trans.tran_en: If someone has poise, they are calm, dignified, and self-controlled
to put or hold something in a carefully balanced position, especially above something else

trans.tran_cn: 使平衡，保持（某种姿势），抓紧，使稳定
trans.tran_en: to put or hold something in a carefully balanced position, especially above something else
